---
layout:         post-mbed-org
title:          "Embedded World 2012"
date:           2012-02-26T11:31:53.000Z
author:         Amit Naran
tags:           Embedded, world
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/Embedded-World-2012/
---

<p>
  <img src=
  "https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/anaran/_scaled_embedded_world.png"
  alt="/media/uploads/anaran/_scaled_embedded_world.png" title=
  "/media/uploads/anaran/_scaled_embedded_world.png">
</p>
<p>
  <a href="http://www.embedded-world.de/en/" rel=
  "nofollow">Embedded World</a>, Nuremberg, Germany, is one of the
  largest conferences for the international embedded community.
  This year we will be showcasing some of the latest developments
  in the mbed world on the ARM Stand.<br>
</p>
<p>
  Where: Exhibition Centre Nuremberg, Nuremberg Germany<br>
  When: 28th February - 1st March 2012<br>
  Location: ARM Stand, Hall 4/4-336<br>
</p>
<p>
  <br>
  If you are heading to the show - come over and say hello! It's
  going to be a great event for us.
</p>
<p>
  We’ll be showing off the simplicity of building <a href=
  "/handbook/USBDevice">USB prototypes</a> using the NEW <a href=
  "/handbook/mbed-NXP-LPC11U24">mbed NXP LPC11U24
  Microcontroller</a> – including the grand unveiling of the
  <a href="/blog/entry/Can-you-guess-what-it-is-yet/">mystery
  prototype</a> that had you all guessing a couple weeks back. So
  it’s your last chance to put forward your ideas on what it might
  be :).
</p>
<p>
  Our very own <span><span class="authortext"><a href=
  "/users/simon/"><img alt="" class="icon" src=
  "data:image/jpeg;base64,">
  </a> <a href="/users/simon/">Simon Ford</a></span></span> will
  also present a Technical Talk on <strong>Connecting
  Microcontrollers to the Cloud</strong> at the conference. He’ll
  discuss the framework behind the multi-transport <a href=
  "/cookbook/IOT">Internet of Things</a> demos that we will also be
  showing.
</p>
<p>
  We will also be reporting from this years show so be sure to keep
  an eye on the blog to see the mbed stand, and what else is going
  on in exciting the world of mbed.
</p>
